metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15720 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Dogtag PKI through 10.8.3, the pki.client.PKIConnection class did not enable python-requests certificate validation. Since the verify parameter was hard-coded in all request functions, it was not possible to override the setting. As a result, tools making use of this class, such as the pki-server command, may have been vulnerable to Person-in-the-Middle attacks in certain non-localhost use cases. This is fixed in 10.9.0-b1.

notes.Note: avital> The CVE fix changes the API with the potential to break software which calls dogtag-pki under certain circumstances. If the fix is backported, the freeipa package must also be updated silmitaniously with https://github.com/freeipa/freeipa/pull/4820. Additionally, other packages which use dogtag-pki must be investigated and updated if needed.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
